parameters.definition: Cost of running factory 1 for 1 hour
Number of black teddy bears produced in factory 1 per hour
Number of white teddy bears produced in factory 1 per hour
Number of brown teddy bears produced in factory 1 per hour
Cost of running factory 2 for 1 hour
Number of black teddy bears produced in factory 2 per hour
Number of white teddy bears produced in factory 2 per hour
Daily minimum required number of black teddy bears
Daily minimum required number of white teddy bears
Daily minimum required number of brown teddy bears

description: A teddy bear company produces three different colored bears: black, white, and brown. These bears are made in two different factories. Running factory 1 for 1 hour costs \param{CostF1} and produces \param{BlackF1} black teddy bears, \param{WhiteF1} white teddy bears, and \param{BrownF1} brown ones. Running factory 2 for 1 hour costs \param{CostF2} and produces \param{BlackF2} black teddy bears and \param{WhiteF2} white teddy bears (but no brown ones). To meet children's demand, at least \param{MinBlack} black teddy bears, \param{MinWhite} white teddy bears, and \param{MinBrown} brown teddy bears must be made daily. Given this information, develop a linear programming problem assuming the teddy bear company wants to minimize the cost of production.
